The index of the path in pathPanel.LayoutPaths.
The index of the first child to be laid out on this path.

member.summary: The index of the next child to be arranged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.DistributionStrategy.Span
member.summary: The distance in arc length that will be used for layout.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.DistributionStrategy.Step
member.summary: The distance in arc length to walk along the current polyline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.DistributionStrategy.Capacity
member.summary: The total number of elements to be arranged on the LayoutPath.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.EvenDistributionStrategy
member.summary: Distributes the children of a path panel along a layout path. Even distribution means that there is equal arclength between the centers of all the elements on the path.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.LayoutPath.transformedPolylines
member.summary: Ideally, we want to cache the Bezier curves before flattening, because transform will affect flattening. That requires us to cache curves that we don't support very well yet. Instead, we cache the flatten points in distribution strategy and transform them on demand.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.PaddedDistributionStrategy
member.summary: Distributes the children of a layout path based on the size of the children and a given padding between the children. The distance in arclength between children is determined by the padding plus the sum of the radii of the children's bounding boxes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.Utilities.GetLogicalChildren(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Retrieves all the logical children of a framework element using a breadth-first search. For performance reasons this method manually manages the stack instead of using recursion.
member.param: The parent framework element.
member.returns: The logical children of the framework element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Controls.Utilities.GetLogicalDescendents(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Retrieves all the logical descendents of a framework element using a breadth-first search. For performance reasons this method manually manages the stack instead of using recursion.
member.param: The parent framework element.
member.returns: The logical children of the framework element.
